page.title: 18Flora
page.content: There is a wide range of flora especially on the roadside and in the few remaining hedges. Many of the field hedges have been removed but some of the roadside ones are very old. Early in the year snowdrops pink and yellow primroses followed by cowslips are to be found near the hedges. In May the roadsides are white with cow parsley, and as the crops ripen there are poppies. Hidden away in odd corners are some protected species. This area has been badly hit by dutch elm disease, where whold stands of trees have had to be removed. These are being replaced by new trees of a different species. Where a farmer has an odd shape piece of land he will often plant it with trees. There are several woods in our block, mostly deciduous, mostly oak, chestnut and a few beech.
